thread.title: Hunt and Aussie cult hero set for NZ UFC event
thread.title_full: Hunt and Aussie cult hero set for NZ UFC event

title: Hunt and Aussie cult hero set for NZ UFC event
text:
Kelly breaks down UFC 209 win 3:55 Mark Hunt set to fight Derrick Lewis at Auckland UFC Fight Night, Dan Kelly likely to face Derek Brunson a few seconds ago by Damon Martin, Fox Sports US with staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS MARK Hunt is set to return to action against Derrick Lewis at UFC Fight Night in Auckland, New Zealand on June 11. 
Lewis, who scored a knockout win over Travis Browne in February, confirmed the fight via Twitter on Monday following an initial report from MMAJunkie.com. My next opponent is Mark Hunt in New Zealand ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡¿ June 10th #FoxSports1 pic.twitter.com/TUijbiz2TJ â€” Derrick Lewis (@Thebeast_ufc) March 20, 2017 
Lewis actually asked for a fight with Hunt after his win over Browne, which marked his sixth victory in a row with five of those ending by knockout or TKO. 
Hunt will return following a disappointing outing in his last fight when he suffered a brutal knockout courtesy of Alistair Overeem at UFC 209 in early March. 
Hunt has gone 2-3 with one no contest over his past six fights but he will look to get back on track when facing Lewis on home soil when they face off in June. It will be the time Australian Hunt has fought in his country of birth in an MMA career spanning 13 years. 
He will require a medical clearance before signing a bout agreement as he is currently under medical suspension until April 19 following the brutalloss to Overeem. 
Meanwhile multiple MMA outlets have reported veteran Aussie fighter Kelly is likely to face Brunson at the Auckland event. Kelly has continued to defy the odds and upset UFC legend Rashad Evans at UFC 209 to improve his career record to 6-1 . Daniel Kelly (R) in action against Rashad Evans. Source: Getty Images 
Brunson (16-5) is coming off a unanimous decision loss to Anderson Silva and before that he suffered a first round KO against Australian Robbie Whittaker. 
This will be the second UFC event held in New Zealand and first since UFC Fight Night 43 in Auckland in 2014.
